title: Valentine's Day 2007
body:
After much deliberation and hand wringing, we have decided NOT to continue our tradition of showing films about female genital mutilation on Valentine's Day. I know this might come as a shock to the the four people who came to see MOOLAADE last year on Valentine's Day, but we decided to strike out and try something new. This year for V-Day we will be hosting our second "Dinner and a Movie" event at Mille's. The film will be the romantic French classic AMELIE, starring tooth-shattering cutie Audrey Tautou, and dinner and desert will be provided by Mille's... of course.

As was the case with our first "Dinner and a Movie" in March of 2006, seating will be limited. Tickets are $50 per couple (includes 2 tickets, dinner, desert, and non-alcoholic drinks), and will go on sale on February 1st. We will NOT be doing online sales for this event, so you will need to swing by the theater to pick up your super special event pass. Again, I apologize to those of you who were looking forward to the next installment in our female genital mutilation series. Keep your hopes up though... there's always next year!
author: Dan

comments.author: EdMo
comments.body: I know a few....

comments.body: Too late. The show's all sold out. Now we get to deal with pissed off procrastinators for the next week.

Posted By: danMaybe we could have a special cage set up for the "singles."

comments.author: ingrid
comments.body:
dan, you COULD section off the corner with a big black curtain and reserve those last six seats for single people. ariananana and i and others could crouch in the dark, eating chocolate ice cream without spoons and jealously eying the couples. no one would have to know.
this is my suggestion.

comments.body: This event is THREE couples away from being totally sold out.

comments.author: ariananana

i had emergency surgery on valentine's day.

i like the whole single persons bit...how about a giant vat of chocolate ice cream? orrr you could just sell pints of ben and jerry's....

comments.body:
Posted By: ingridbrian, i would ask you to go with me platonically, but you might be unable to resist my Special Low-Cut Valentine's Day Shirt charms, and that would make things between us awkward. plus, we would ruin each other's chances of actually meeting someone to sleep with.
gomz low cutzx! .... i would go with you.. but as of yesterday they only had two tickets left...
are those gone yet.. danicole?
im pretty sure if we introduced ourselves to everyone as swingers... we could work something out
okay and *now* i read what ian commented... i think its workable

comments.author: Ian
comments.body: You would go to a couples event to find other people to sleep with?  Use each other to shoehorn into swinging?  That's so crazy it just might work.

comments.author: dan
comments.body: Our first dinner and a movie event was like that. You could buy one ticket and sit alone in the corner, silently crying into your water glass. Only the V-Day event is a per couple ticket. All the others will be the typical per-ticket sales.

I like that idea.

Dan and Nicole will never do it, though. They're one of them, the couplers, and they have no empathy for single people and their scaly, reptilian skins.

comments.body: So my best gal pal's favorite movie is "Amelie" and I tell her about this event.  We get SO excited.  Then we realize it's ON Valentine's Day, and now her boyfriend wants to take her.  The nerve!  Any plans for a Moxie Pitiful Pathetic Single Persons Dinner and a Movie?

comments.author: nicole
comments.body:
Dan's only half right. We'll be doing possibly two FREE showings of "Until the Violence Stops," a documentary to help raise awareness about domestic abuse and beyond. This helps kick off Drury and MSU's productions of The Vagina Monologues. Dates and times will be on the February schedule.

So, for those of you who were looking forward to women's issues (geesh Dan), please don't fret.
